thread.title: Full details of Exeter's IKEA revealed at groundbreaking ceremony

author: Alex_Richards
title: Full details of Exeter's IKEA revealed at groundbreaking ceremony
text:
Full details of Exeter's IKEA revealed at groundbreaking ceremony By Alex_Richards | Posted: May 17, 2017 4 COMMENTS SHARES Comments (4) 
Full details of the size and scale of Exeter's IKEA have be revealed at a groundbreaking ceremony officially marking the start of building work on the site. 
The company has revealed how large the store will be and what will be sold at the first IKEA in Devon when it opens in the early summer of 2018. 
New pictures of how the store will look were shown at the site next the M5 this morning. IKEA revealed the store will employ 350 people, recruited locally who will all be paid at least the real living wage - and the manager, Nicholas Earle, has strong family links to North Devon. 
It will be the UK's first sustainably built IKEA, meaning it will harvest rainwater and comply to strict environment regulations. The store will be 28,000 square metres large over two floors and will sell the full IKEA range. 
It will have a green room - a large greenhouse displaying IKEA's full outdoor range - as well as a restaurant, creche and space for 1,000 vehicles in teh car park. There will be four order collection points. 
The Swedish home-ware giant is already looking to fill various posts based in Exeter - offering up to £33,000 a year for some roles. 
Jobs include HR administrator, sales department managers, HR business partner, kitchen production manager, customer restaurant manager and Swedish food market and bistro manager. 
Another 480 roles will be created in Sheffield, where Ikea will set up shop this summer. 
Speaking at a "groundbreaking" ceremony in Exeter, Ikea's UK boss Gillian Drakeford said: "As we continue to expand, we're delighted to bring investment to new areas across the country and create new opportunities for local communities. 
"This year we are celebrating Ikea's 30th anniversary in the UK, and we are seeing more demand from customers for more stores in areas closer to where they live." 
In November, Ikea said that UK revenues rose 8.9% to £1.72 billion in the year ending August 31, its fifth consecutive year of sales growth. 
Once opened, the new stores will leave Ikea with 22 outlets in the UK. The retailer also has four smaller format stores. 
Last year Ikea reiterated its commitment to investing in Britain following the Brexit vote, with Ms Drakeford saying at the time: "We believe there is a lot of opportunity in the UK. 
"We've been evaluating our newest stores and formats and yes, absolutely, there will be more stores. We will continue to invest in the UK." 
IKEA is set to open in Exeter next summer... so if you can't wait to get your hands on their flat packed furniture and famous meatballs, then here is what you can expect when they open. 
An IKEA spokesperson has said IKEA's 21st store, off Newcourt Way and A379, will open in early summer 2018. 
The Swedish home-ware giant is already looking to fill various posts based in Exeter - offering up to £33,000 a year for some roles. 
Jobs include HR administrator, sales department managers, HR business partner, kitchen production manager, customer restaurant manager and Swedish food market and bistro manager. 
A spokesman for IKEA said a more detailed timeline for the construction of the store will be unveiled this month, alongside further details about the project. So in case you didn't know....what is IKEA? 
IKEA is a Swedish furniture giant famous for its cheap furniture, the flat packed furniture and let's not forget about the meatballs. The retail giant was founded in 1943 and as of January 2008, it was named the world's largest furniture retailer.

The shop provides tape measures, and pencils and notepads for you to write down price tag details, including where to pick up your item. 
You can grab a big yellow bag for those smaller items you like but bigger items have an Argos-style form to fill in. 
There are lots of details on the price tag of items - colours, materials, sizes, etc. You'll find the shelf number if you can collect the item from the self-serve area or a message to contact staff if you need to collect it at furniture pick-up. What are the opening hours? 
Based on the other branches of IKEA, the Exeter branch is expected to open 11 hours a day.
